abstract.p: Thomas J Smith letter on Anthony Lewis's attacks on Kenneth W Starr's conduct

block.p: While I do not wish to minimize the serious nature of the charges that Anthony Lewis makes against Kenneth W. Starr (column, Nov. 24), I do find Mr. Lewis's warnings of the resulting mortal threat to the Republic -- ''that way lies the rot of liberty for all of us'' -- to be selective.

While I do not wish to minimize the serious nature of the charges that Anthony Lewis makes against Kenneth W. Starr (column, Nov. 24), I do find Mr. Lewis's warnings of the resulting mortal threat to the Republic -- ''that way lies the rot of liberty for all of us'' -- to be selective.

Mr. Lewis finds great danger to the rule of law emanating from the independent counsel's office but appears to find no such threats to the same coming from the highest office in the land, whose occupant engaged in a similar pattern of deception. Real threats to our Republic are not partisan, and neither are those who wish to warn us.
THOMAS J. SMITH Portland, Ore., Nov. 24, 1998
